newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 21.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 21.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Copper prices jumped overnight, closing in London up US$19 a tonne at 2,493. Nickel prices dropped US$165 to 7,690. Brokers also say the big two resources groups are back in favour with foreign fund managers and are benefitting from profit-taking in banks.
Alpha Healthcare Ltd said on Wednesday it planned to raise A$22.7 million through the issue of shares and convertible notes to fund a A$38 million acquisition of Health Care Corporation Pty Ltd.

McCormick and Co Inc is evaluating several options, spokesman Jim Lynn said Tuesday when asked about the company's interest in the spice assets Burns, Philp and Co Ltd plans to sell. On Monday the Australian yeast maker said it would sell its U.S. and European spice and herb business.

Building materials and office supplies group KLZ Ltd said late on Tuesday it had revised down its full year pre-tax earnings estimate due to weaker than expected trading conditions in its second half.
Australian industrial group Email Ltd said on Tuesday workers at its Martin Bright steel plant have agreed earlier today to return to work after a five-week strike.

Marine exploration group Cambridge Gulf Exploration NL said on Tuesday it has made no decision on whether to abandon a bid to operate an offshore diamond mine. Cambridge Gulf was responding an article in the West Australian newspaper on Tuesday which said it had abandoned a four-year effort to operate a diamond mine in favour of investing in a resource project that would provide immediate returns.
